pages.text: A $(item)Focus/$ stores an iota.$(br2)When I craft it, it starts with nothing in it. Using $(action)Scribe's Gambit/$ while holding one in my other hand will pop the stack and save the iota into the $(item)Focus/$. Using $(action)Scribe's Reflection/$ will copy whatever's in the $(item)Focus/$ and push it onto the stack.

It occurs to me I could store a list of patterns in a $(item)Focus/$, and later recall them and evaluate them with $(action)Hermes' Gambit/$. This way I can cast complex spells, or parts of spells, without having to draw them over and over.$(br2)I can use this like a slightly-less-convenient $(l:items/hexcasting#artifact)$(item)Artifact/$, but the real power comes from putting common "phrases" in a $(item)Focus/$, like the patterns for raycasting from my position and look.
Also, if I store an entity in a $(item)Focus/$ and try to recall it after it has died or otherwise disappeared, it will read Null instead.
